intro: Allosandra verbenifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf screw pine, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to salty air and well-drained soils. Allosandra verbenifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and resilience.
